missed.title: Path Traversal in Web Application
missed.reason: The path traversal vulnerability expected at home.php (lines 1-4) and admin/index.php (lines 1-27) was not discovered during the penetration test. The actual findings focused on NoSQL injection, authentication bypass, CSRF vulnerabilities, and missing security headers, but no path traversal attack vectors were identified or reported. This represents a gap in the test coverage for file path manipulation vulnerabilities.

extra.title: NoSQL Injection in Contact Form Name Field
extra.assessment: New discovery - represents a legitimate vulnerability not in the expected findings. The application fails to validate that POST parameters are strings before passing them to htmlspecialchars(), allowing array-based NoSQL operator injection attacks.

extra.title: Missing Critical Security Headers
extra.assessment: New discovery - represents a legitimate vulnerability not in the expected findings. Application fails to set X-Frame-Options, X-XSS-Protection, CSP, X-Content-Type-Options, and HSTS headers, leaving the application vulnerable to clickjacking, XSS, MIME sniffing, and protocol downgrade attacks.

extra.title: Email Header Injection in Contact Form
extra.assessment: New discovery - represents a legitimate vulnerability not in the expected findings. The application accepts arbitrary input in the email field without filtering CRLF characters, allowing attackers to inject additional email headers (Bcc, Cc, Subject, etc.).

extra.title: Missing CSRF Token Protection on Forms
extra.assessment: New discovery - represents a legitimate vulnerability not in the expected findings. Both login and contact forms accept POST requests without CSRF token validation, allowing attackers to perform unauthorized actions on behalf of authenticated users.

extra.title: Information Disclosure - PHP Warning via Type Confusion in Contact Form
extra.assessment: New discovery - represents a legitimate vulnerability not in the expected findings. Type confusion errors cause PHP warnings revealing file paths and line numbers, enabling application reconnaissance.

extra.title: Missing CSRF Protection on Contact Form
extra.assessment: New discovery - represents a duplicate/related finding to the broader CSRF vulnerability discovery. Specific emphasis on contact form CSRF vulnerability with cross-origin request testing confirmation.

extra.title: Authentication Bypass - Unrestricted Access to Admin Panel
extra.assessment: New discovery - represents a legitimate critical vulnerability not in the expected findings. The admin panel is directly accessible without any authentication or authorization checks, allowing unauthenticated users complete access to administrative functions.

extra.title: Missing Rate Limiting on Contact Form Submissions
extra.assessment: New discovery - represents a legitimate vulnerability not in the expected findings. The application accepts unlimited contact form submissions without throttling, allowing spam, DoS attacks, and automated abuse at high speed.

extra.title: NoSQL Injection Vulnerabilities in Contact Form Email and Message Fields
extra.assessment: New discovery - represents an extended finding related to NoSQL injection. The email and message fields exhibit the same type confusion vulnerability as the name field, indicating systemic input validation failures across multiple form fields.

extra.title: No Rate Limiting on Login Attempts - Brute Force Attack Possible
extra.assessment: New discovery - represents a legitimate vulnerability not in the expected findings. The login endpoint accepts unlimited authentication attempts without rate limiting or account lockout mechanisms, enabling high-speed brute force password attacks.

extra.title: Weak Authentication Implementation - No Session Management
extra.assessment: New discovery - represents a legitimate architectural vulnerability not in the expected findings. The application lacks any session_start() initialization or $_SESSION usage, preventing proper authentication state tracking and access control enforcement across the application.
